titlestmt.titleproper: Women's Presbyterian Missionary Union of Greater Kansas City records 1911-1938
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Women's Presbyterian Missionary Union of Greater Kansas City records

bioghist.p: The Woman's Presbyterian Missionary Union of Greater Kansas City, Parkville, Independence, Missouri, and Overland Park was organized to create and increase intelligent interest in worldwide missions, promote acquaintance and sisterhood among its members and to encourage the circulation of missionary literature. Membership consisted of missionary societies of Presbyterian churches in the districts named in the organization's title.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Woman's Presbyterian Missionary Union of Greater Kansas City. Minutes include: routine business, such as election of officers; lists of reports read before the committee; minutes of semi-annual meetings of the Woman's Presbyterian Missionary Union of Greater Kansas City, 1918-1938; printed programs of semi-annual meetings; lists of officers (1906-1918); lists of members; constitution and by-laws; places of meeting; and a list of addresses made by foreign missionaries.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
